name: Sensitive Intermediaries
description: Assessment of intermediary involvement including brokers, consultants, sales representatives, lobbyists, public and government advisers, and licensing agents. Evaluates connections to state entities and corruption risk.

Q1.text: Is the client involved as an intermediary (broker, consultant, sales representative, lobbyist, public and government adviser, licensing agent, etc.)?
Q1.summary: Intermediary Involvement Verification - Does the client activity consist of an intermediary role?

Q2.text: Is the client activity carried out by a reputable professional service firm that is regulated in the area of anti-corruption and capable of evidencing this?
Q2.summary: Accepted Intermediaries Verification - Regulated professional firm check

Q3.text: Does the client's intermediary activity involve any connection to a State-Named Entity (SNE), government institution, or public official?

Q4.text: Is the client operating in a country or sector with high corruption risk according to recognized corruption indices (e.g., Transparency International CPI)?

Q5.text: Does the client activity constitute a service agreement, consultancy contract, or fee-based arrangement between a third party and a State-Named Entity (SNE) or governmental institution to obtain or retain business?
Q5.summary: Intermediaries Connection Verification - SNE/government arrangement check

Q6.text: Does the intermediary have any direct or indirect relationship with Politically Exposed Persons (PEPs) or government decision-makers?

Q1_NO.reason: Client is not involved as an intermediary

Q2_YES.reason: Reputable professional service firm that is regulated in anti-corruption - not considered SIAP

Q5_YES.reason: Intermediary with service agreement/consultancy contract with SNE or government institution to obtain or retain business requires Enhanced Due Diligence

Q5_NO.reason: No service agreement or fee-based arrangement with SNE or government institution identified

Q6_YES.reason: Intermediary with PEP/government decision-maker relationship in high corruption risk environment requires Enhanced Due Diligence
